metadata.Title: CVE-2023-30774 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in the libtiff library. This flaw causes a heapbuffer overflow issue via the TIFFTAG_INKNAMES and TIFFTAG_NUMBEROFINKSvalues.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-30774` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm5
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm5
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm5
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm5').
